cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 220 mi SSE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northwest across the Yucatán Channel Tuesday, then turning north-northwest over the central Gulf of Mexico and aiming for a Friday landfall along the central-to-eastern Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coastline (between Vermilion Bay and the Mississippi Delta)
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: Storm remains well offshore of Corpus Christi ( >250 mi ) throughout the forecast period

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches/warnings confined to western Cuba and the Yucatán Peninsula—none issued for the Texas coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as above; no Texas warnings in effect
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest coastal impacts expected from the northeast Yucatán to Louisiana/Mississippi; Texas coastline west of High Island, including Corpus Christi, only feels distant swells
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤4%) of brief 34-kt gusts late Thursday–Friday; sustained tropical-storm-force winds unlikely
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; only minor wave run-up possible on east-facing beaches
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer bands could bring 0.5–1.0 inch of rain Thursday night/Friday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells will build seas to 5–8 ft in the near-shore approaches, causing choppy harbor entrances and possible pilot‐boat restrictions
